Trial_Design.evidence: Randomized, double-blind, and longitudinal, with matched healthy control subjects

Intervention.evidence: before and after 6 months of bilateral DBS in the GPi or the STN

Objective.evidence: We made quantitative measures of jaw velocity to compare the relative effectiveness of DBS in the globus pallidus internus (GPi) or the subthalamic nucleus (STN).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The peak velocities of self-scaled and externally-scaled jaw movements were studied

Result_Outcome.evidence: Self-scaled jaw velocity was impaired by the DBS procedure in STN; velocity was significantly decreased across all postoperative conditions compared to either the off- and on-levodopa baseline conditions.
